BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Name: Asynchronous Auto Ping
BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This is a simple bot configured to ping the KeepAlive.aspx page of this DotNetNuke instance asynchronously with a delay to trigger the scheduler on a regular basis if set in request mode.

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Ping Own Instance
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription: That rule runs a single httprequests to keep the website up and running, and trigger the scheduler if set to request mode. An external ping is a preferred additional method, since if the web site is shut down for unexpected reasons, the autoping won't be triggered to bring it back.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Send Ping HttpRequest asynchronously
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This action pings the keep alive page of this instance. It is set to an asynchronous queue with a 2 min delay to trigger the scheduler if set to request mode.

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Sub Conditions Provider
ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Allows to build a condition tree with sub conditions

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Static Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Simply matches according to the static value configured

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Dynamic Expression Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Matches according to the evaluation of a dynamic code expression defined in the Flee language

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Log Event Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Inserts a new log in the DotNetNuke event log. Automatic email alert can be configured accordingly

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Web Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Performs a web call to a web address

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Loop Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to loop running a sub bot over a custom collection. On each run, the current item of the collection is affected to a custom variable.

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Send Email Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Sends an email to a list of destination addresses. Token replace is available for all text fields and target address list.

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Define Variables Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to declare and instanciate a set of variables, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Multiple Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Runs sub sequences of Actions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Sub Bot Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to run a sub-bot as a dedicated action. Because of the sequential nature of the engine, the subbot triggers each previous step up to the current step, the rules and action should be configured accordingly

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Serialize Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to serialize a given entity, result of dynamic expression, into a string, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Deserialize Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to deserialize a given string, result of dynamic expression, into a typed object, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: While Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to loop running a sub bot while a boolean condition evaluates to true.

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Object Actions Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to call object methods or set object properties

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: String Filter Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to you to manipulate a string, by either running a series of transformations or performing xpath selects

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Empty Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider performs no particular action but can be used for adding a sleep time for instance

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: File Read Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to read a file to a given String variable, given its path by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: File Write Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to write a content to a file, given its path and the content to write by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: File Manager Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to browse or delete files and folders, given a parent path by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Execute Sql Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Execute a call to a stored procedure, a Sql script or sql query and returns the result

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Run Program Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Run an executable program given its path and parameters

BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Name: Keep Alive Pings
BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This bot pings a set of given urls in order to keep the corresponding web applications alive. It is configured to be used a user bot, with the list of urls to ping provided as a variable with custom parameters.

VariableInfo.Name: UrlList
VariableInfo.Decription: This is a list of url to ping together with the corresponding parameters.

PingUrlInfo.Name: Sample Url
PingUrlInfo.Decription: This sample Url pings this instance dedicated keepalive page. If you plan on providing the service to external users, you should delete that entry to provide them with a empty list variable by default.

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Ping Web Urls
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription: That rule lopps against a given ping url list variable, runs httprequests while and collecting measurements. It then sends email alerts if the target sites fail to respond, or respond too slowly. Finallly each user bot parameter is updated with corresponding statistics.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: For each Url Defined
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This bot uses a variable that contains a list of urls to ping together with parameters. This is a loop action performed for each url defined in the corresponding list variable

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Ping According to Schedule
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Each Url can be configured to have its own schedule period, and can be disabled. We define the ping procedure as a multiple action with a condition checking for those parameters

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Ping is enabled and Last Run is older than schedule

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Send Url HttpRequest
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This action sends a http request to the url defined in the individual ping variable. It is done synchronously and 2 variables are created to collect the timing measurements and any raised exception when available.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Send Alerts
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This action sends email alerts according to results and user configuration : alerts must be enabled.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Ping Url has email alerts enabled
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This condition checks the corresponding boolean property

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Send website down Alert
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This action sends an alert email if an exception was raised during the ping http request.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: PingException is not null
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: If an exception was raised, the web action was configured to create the corresponding PingException variable.

TokenizedText.Text:
The Monitoring agent has just detected that the site [Context:Items:CurrentPingUrl:Name] stopped responding.

Last request sent to the url [Context:Items:CurrentPingUrl:PingUrl] has failed with the following exception:

[Context:Items:PingException:ToString]

The Monitoring agent has just detected that the site [Context:Items:CurrentPingUrl:Name] stopped responding.

Last request sent to the url [Context:Items:CurrentPingUrl:PingUrl] has failed with the following exception:

[Context:Items:PingException:ToString]

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: PingDuration is more than the defined limit

The Monitoring agent has just detected that the site [Context:Items:CurrentPingUrl:Name] responds slowly.

Last request sent to the url [Context:Items:CurrentPingUrl:PingUrl] had a duration of [Context:Items:PingDuration:ToString]

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Message:
The Monitoring agent has just detected that the site [Context:Items:CurrentPingUrl:Name] responds slowly.

Last request sent to the url [Context:Items:CurrentPingUrl:PingUrl] had a duration of [Context:Items:PingDuration:ToString]

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Update Statistics
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This action relies on the fact that the bot should be used as a user bot, in which case the user variables are saved after each run. If the master bot is run, the variables are static and you can rely on the bot history instead.

VariableInfo.Name: success
VariableInfo.Decription: This boolean variable is computed as the absence of a raised exception. It could alternatively also account for the slow duration alerts.

BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Name: Google Nearby Places Alert
BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Decription:
This bot illustrates gathering targeted web content on a regular basis and sending alert emails when new content is found.
It performs a google custom place search with user defined parameters, collects the result into a persistent variable, and sends an alert email with new results when found.
Unlike with the previous bot, no dedicated classes were created to perform the task. Simple parameters are defined and configured in the UserBot settings using property definitions similar to those available for DotNetNuke profile properties.
The ProxyPool rule illustrates gathering open proxies to be used with subsequent webrequests, allowing the bot to run anonymously. Feel free to copy the rule in other bots with that requirement.

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Load Proxy Pool
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription:
This rule builds a proxy pool from a combination of configuration data, and data automatically extracted by running a Xpath Query against a series of web pages.
Default parameters gather a collection of open proxies, and should not be used to post sensitive information, but rather illustrates building variable from web content.
Also, note that Google enforces a strict policy of blocking proxies generating too much traffic. Accordingly, most open proxies gathered by the bot will fail the verification test configured within the ProxyPool variable definition, which is expected behaviour. If you want to use open proxies for a distinct purpose, you should change the verification url to your need, allowing for more proxies to be validated.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Create ProxyPool
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We instantiate an object of type WebProxyPool and put it in cache for later reuse.

VariableInfo.Name: ProxyPool
VariableInfo.Decription: The pool is defined as a simple variable, which allows you to add your own predefined proxies. ProxyPool is the name of the variable defined here. The Use Clone option is checked, so that additional proxies added when the bot is executed do not impact the original proxy pool definition. In the verification tab, we set a template request as verification mean to only keep proxies allowed to issue that kind of request.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Feed ProxyPool
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: If the Proxypool has less than the defined minimum number of proxies, we feed the pool with open proxies gathered on the web.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: ProxyPool has few available proxies
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We feed the pool with new proxies only if it has less available proxies than the minimum number defined

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Clean Old Proxies
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Before we add new proxies, we remove the existing proxies which have proved unreliable through multiple testing.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: ProxyNodes exists
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We only perform that action if the previous parsing was successful, ie if the corresponding variable was created.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: For each page of open Proxies
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We loop against a series of pages, which contain open proxies. The Integer parameter ProxyPageNb allows to define the url of each page.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Get Proxies Page
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We obtain a list of open proxies from the site hidemyass.com. We request the corresponding page for later parsing. This http request itself makes use of the proxy pool to be fed with new proxies. Note the use of the ProxyPageNb parameter from the outer loop to define the url.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: ProxyPool has less that 3 available proxies
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We feed the pool with new proxies only if it has less that 3 available proxies left.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Select Proxy Nodes
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We now parse the httprequest String response using XPath queries to retrieve the individual proxy parameters, namely the domain, port, speed, connection time and scheme. That action resturns a list of dictionaries with the corresponding parameters. We enable the "Add if Existing" option to merge the results of each page into a single list variable. Note that the compound XPath query extracts html tags as well as attributes.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: HtmlProxies is not empty
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We perform that opertion only if the previous httprequest succesfully responded with the target page to be parsed.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: For each Proxy Node
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We go over the list of dictionaries built with the xpath parsing of the original page, and build Proxy objects from the corresponding parameters

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: ProxyNodes exists
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We only perform that action if the previous parsing was successful, ie if the corresponding variable was created.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Add Proxy to Pool
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: To add a proxy to the pool, we operate on the ProxyPool variable directly. We add a condition to filter out proxies too slow or with an unsupported scheme.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Proxy is fast enough and Sheme is Http
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: .Net WebProxy only supports Http proxies, so we have to filter out https and socks proxies from the list. Furthermore, we filter out proxies with slow speed or slow connection time

VariableInfo.Name: webProxy
VariableInfo.Decription: The WebProxyInfo class contains a constructor, which we can use with the parsed parameters.

VariableInfo.Name: strAddress
VariableInfo.Decription: We concatenate the parameters to form the complete proxy address

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Load Google Results
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We perform the Google search for the given user search parameters and the number of pages also defined as a user parameter.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: For each Google Page
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We operate the loop by defining a CurrentPageNb Integer parameter incremented from 0 to the NbPages user parameter.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Perform Http Request
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription:
We perform the HttpRequest corresponding to the targeted google search, passing the "What" and "Where" user parameters as the "q" querystring parameters, and transforming the "CurrentPageNb" into the "start" querystring parameter.
Note that the use of the ProxyPool variable is activated but not enforced, which means that without any proxy available, the httprequest is still executed without a proxy attached. If running behind a proxy is a necessity, you should activate the the corresponding checkbox.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Select Place Nodes
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We now parse the httprequest String response using XPath queries to retrieve the individual places results parameters, namely the name and url. That action returns a list of dictionaries with the corresponding parameters. The "Add if Existing" option is also checked to merge the result list from each page into a single PlaceNodes list.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: HtmlPlaces is not empty
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We perform that opertion only if the previous httprequest succesfully responded with the target page to be parsed.

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Process Results
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription: In order to process the Google Place results, we use a dictionary structure using the places names as a key and the result dictionaries of xpath extracted fields as values.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Define Existing and New Places Dictionaries
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We define an "ExistingPlaces" dictionary of such structure, which is configured to be dumped in the bot "history" tab, and reported from history on each run (note the corresponding checkbox activated in the definitions tab). We also define a "NewPlaces" dictionary to collect the places not found in the previous runs, used later to trigger the alert email. That dictionary is purposely not included in the bot dump. If you want to include it in the dump, then you should move its definition into a distinct "Define Variables" action with the "Report from History" option unchecked (we don't want to report the new places between bot runs)

VariableInfo.Name: ExistingPlaces
VariableInfo.Decription: The custom type "SerializableDictionary" used here simply accounts for the fact that the common "Dictionary" type is only XmlSerialisable from .Net verion 4.0. Note that we use a "dictionary of dictionaries" because the places results are pased into dictionaries of fields. This allows for easy customization, yet you may want to provide your own typed structures to collect your custom data.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: For each Place Node
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We go over the list of dictionaries built with the xpath parsing of the original page, fix the places names which by Google, and add the new places if not found in the existing dictionary.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: PlaceNodes exists
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We only perform that action if the previous parsing was successful, ie if the corresponding variable was created.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Fix Place Name
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: The place names are returned Html encoded by Google, we use the HttpUtility.HtmlDecode method to fix them.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Add Place to Control Dictionaries if not existing
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We add the fixed Place node both to the ExistingPlaces and NewPlaces dictionary, if the place if not found in the ExistingPlaces dictionary. Accordingly, the test is configured within the "Conditional" tab

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: ExistingPlaces does not contain CurrentPlace
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We use the "ContainsKey" method to check if the ExistingPlaces dictionary contains the current place.

VariableInfo.Name: key
VariableInfo.Decription: we set the place name as parsed from the xpath query as the key. We use the HtmlDecode function beforehand to properly format the corresponding String

VariableInfo.Name: key
VariableInfo.Decription: we set the place name as parsed from the xpath query as the key. We use the HtmlDecode function beforehand to properly format the corresponding String

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Send Alert Email if new places were found
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: If the NewPlaces dictionary contains elements (as defined in the conditional tab), we send an email to the bot owner, leveraging token replace to edit the email body. Note the use of advanced loop tokens.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: NewPlaces contains at least one element

TokenizedText.Text:
Dear [Context:Items:User:Username],

your Google Places bot has detected that new places of type [Context:Items:What] are referenced nearby your defined location: [Context:Items:Where].

The following places appear in the result:

    [Context:Items:NewPlaces:]
  • [:Value:Name]
    • [/Context:Items:NewPlaces:]

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Message:
Dear [Context:Items:User:Username],

your Google Places bot has detected that new places of type [Context:Items:What] are referenced nearby your defined location: [Context:Items:Where].

The following places appear in the result:

    [Context:Items:NewPlaces:]
  • [:Value:Name]
    • [/Context:Items:NewPlaces:]
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.EmailObject: New places found by your Google bot

BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.DumpVariables: Where, What, NbPages, User.Username, ProxyPool, ExistingPlaces

BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Name: Bitcoin - Mt.Gox Trader 2.0
BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Decription:
This bot is an automated trader connecting to the Mt. Gox Bitcoins exchange's API. See www.mtgox.com and www.bitcoin.org for more information.
The bot takes some user account Credentials, the exchange settings and the trading Strategy as initial parameters. It connects to the API to retrieve the account's wallet and market data, computes new orders locally according to the strategy, and connects back to the API to apply updates.

VariableInfo.Name: Credentials
VariableInfo.Decription: Those are the credentials to an existing user account on the Exchange platform. The bot passes them as parameters while making API calls.

VariableInfo.Name: Exchange
VariableInfo.Decription: This entity contains information specific to the Bitcoin Exchange platform, such as commission fees, API urls and an optional Filter to apply on JSon results before Deserialization is performed. The expected data corresponds to Mt. Gox legacy API.

Instance.Name: Mt. Gox Exchange
Instance.Decription: Mt. Gox applies a 0,65% commission fee on each trade by default, and recently lowered the minimum order amount to 0,01 btc. The default urls point to the legacy API. No Filter is needed since the Mt. Gox JSon format serves as a reference to deserialize trading Entities.

VariableInfo.Name: Strategy
VariableInfo.Decription: The trading Strategy entity is expected to implement the ITradingStrategy interface, which exposes the following function to be overriden: Public MustOverride Function ComputeNewOrders(ByVal objWallet As Wallet, ByVal objMarket As MarketInfo, ByVal objExchange As ExchangeInfo) As Wallet Default Strategy implementation runs a band oriented trading algorithm with many parameters available for customization.

Instance.Name: Linear Trading Strategy
Instance.Decription:
The default strategy places orders in a trading band centered on the current market price. Pricing is symmetrical for asks and bids.
The ask order expression is defined by
Order.Value(Price) = aAsk * Price + bAsk or Order.Amount(Price) = aAsk + bAsk / Price
with aAsk and bAsk well defined by 2 points:
CurrentOrders.HighestAsk and LowestAskLimit
with the corresponding local variables:
LowestAskLimitPrice = Market.Ticker.Last * (1 + Exchange.AskCommission/100)
LowestAskLimitValue = CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100)
AskSpan = CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Price - LowestAskLimitPrice
The price distribution is defined by reducing the distance to the ticker. Default expression applies a linear.coefficient to the price
NewLowestAsk.Price = LowestAsk.Price * 99% until the central margin is reached
Existing orders can also be updated or cancelled to do some clean up when the Ticker moves, according to the defined parameters in the order updates tab. More specifically, you should make sure that your open orders are not cancelled every other run because of those parameters.

AskOrderAmountExpression.Expression: (CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan) + (((CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) - (LowestAskLimitPrice * CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan))/ Price)

VariableInfo.Name: History
VariableInfo.Decription: This parameter serves recording series of the balance and price collected during trading runs. It is also use by the default strategy to identify trading trends and avoid placing repeated orders when the price spikes quickly.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Log Credential Status

TokenizedText.Text:
Credentials to be enabled for user [Context:Items:User:Username]
Credentials Disabled: [Context:Items:Credentials:APIKey:Disabled] Last History: [Context:Items:History:LastEvents:Instances:0:Time]

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Message:
Credentials to be enabled for user [Context:Items:User:Username]
Credentials Disabled: [Context:Items:Credentials:APIKey:Disabled] Last History: [Context:Items:History:LastEvents:Instances:0:Time]

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Enable Credentials
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: The bot is disabled directly by modifying the current Credentials variable. This works for user bots because user parameters are saved after each run. It won't work for a master bot.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Credentials Are Disabled and History is Recent
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This condition checks if the credentials variable is valid, i.e, the password is non empty, and it was not disabled on a previous run.

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Collect Data
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This rule consists of a series of calls to the Exchange API to collect the account open orders and balance into a Wallet variable and the Ticker and MarketDepth into a Market variable.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Get Wallet
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: In order to create the corresponding wallet variable, one must collect the open orders and balance as Json through API calls and deserialize the corresponding strings into .Net variables before merging them into a Wallet entity.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Get Orders From API
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This web action posts the supplied credentials as parameters to a Http Post Request to the Exchange configured Url. It retrieves a Json string with open orders, which may also contain the balance (such as with MtGox legacy API)

VariableInfo.Name: nonce
VariableInfo.Decription: The request must contain an extra value "nonce" which must be an always incrementing numeric value.

VariableInfo.Name: Rest-Key
VariableInfo.Decription: This is the API key as generated from the Echange account settings

VariableInfo.Name: Rest-Sign
VariableInfo.Decription: This is the request signature generated from postdata using HMAC-SHA512.

VariableInfo.Name: hmac
VariableInfo.Decription: Keyed hash algorithm that is constructed from the SHA-512 hash function and used as a Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC)

VariableInfo.Name: key
VariableInfo.Decription: The secret key for HMAC encryption as generated from the Echange account settings

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Deserialize Wallet
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: The JsonWallet String variable previously retrieved can be deserialized into an instance of the corresponding Wallet class using a JayRock Serializer.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: JsonWallet exists
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This condition checks that the JsonWallet was correctly created by the previous web call.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Process Invalid Credentials
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Mt Gox bans IP addresses with too many failed login attempts. Accordingly, faulty user bots must be disabled to avoid the ban. A notification email also invites the user to update his password.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Wallet not null and Wallet has error
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This sub condition matches if the wallet was properly deserialized and its "error" field contains an error message

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Wallet is not null
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: this condition checks if the Wallet variable exists

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Wallet contains an error
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: In case of faulty credentials, Exchange sites return a json message of the form {"error":"Not logged in."} The corresponding deserialized object contains the appropriate field to be checked accordingly.

FleeExpression.Expression: Wallet.error.Contains("Must be logged in") Or Wallet.error.Contains("denied")

BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Name: Bitcoin - CryptoXChange Trader
BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Decription:
This bot is an automated trader connecting to the Crypto X Change Bitcoins exchange's API. See www.cryptoxchange.com and www.bitcoin.org for more information.
The bot takes some user account Credentials, the exchange settings and the trading Strategy as initial parameters. It connects to the API to retrieve the account's wallet and market data, computes new orders locally according to the strategy, and connects back to the API to apply updates.

VariableInfo.Name: Credentials
VariableInfo.Decription: Those are the credentials to an existing user account on the Exchange platform. The bot passes them as parameters while making API calls.

VariableInfo.Name: Exchange
VariableInfo.Decription: This entity contains information specific to the Bitcoin Exchange platform, such as commission fees, API urls and an optional Filter to apply on JSon results before Deserialization is performed. The expected data corresponds to Mt. Gox legacy API.

Instance.Name: Crypto X Change Exchange
Instance.Decription: Crypto X Change applies a 0,65% commission fee on each trade by default, and recently lowered the minimum order amount to 0,01 btc.

VariableInfo.Name: Strategy
VariableInfo.Decription: The trading Strategy entity is expected to implement the ITradingStrategy interface, which exposes the following function to be overriden: Public MustOverride Function ComputeNewOrders(ByVal objWallet As Wallet, ByVal objMarket As MarketInfo, ByVal objExchange As ExchangeInfo) As Wallet Default Strategy implementation runs a band oriented trading algorithm with many parameters available for customization.

Instance.Name: Linear Trading Strategy
Instance.Decription:
The default strategy places orders in a trading band centered on the current market price. Pricing is symmetrical for asks and bids.
The ask order expression is defined by
Order.Value(Price) = aAsk * Price + bAsk or Order.Amount(Price) = aAsk + bAsk / Price
with aAsk and bAsk well defined by 2 points:
CurrentOrders.HighestAsk and LowestAskLimit
with the corresponding local variables:
LowestAskLimitPrice = Market.Ticker.Last * (1 + Exchange.AskCommission/100)
LowestAskLimitValue = CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100)
AskSpan = CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Price - LowestAskLimitPrice
The price distribution is defined by reducing the distance to the ticker. Default expression applies a linear.coefficient to the price
NewLowestAsk.Price = LowestAsk.Price * 99% until the central margin is reached
Existing orders can also be updated or cancelled to do some clean up when the Ticker moves, according to the defined parameters in the order updates tab. More specifically, you should make sure that your open orders are not cancelled every other run because of those parameters.

AskOrderAmountExpression.Expression: (CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan) + (((CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) - (LowestAskLimitPrice * CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan))/ Price)

VariableInfo.Name: History
VariableInfo.Decription: This parameter serves recording series of the balance and price collected during trading runs. It is also use by the default strategy to identify trading trends and avoid placing repeated orders when the price spikes quickly.

BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Name: Bitcoin - Mt.Gox Trader 3.0 - Instawallet
BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Decription:
This bot is an automated trader connecting to the Mt. Gox Bitcoins exchange's API. See www.mtgox.com and www.bitcoin.org for more information.
The bot takes some user account Credentials, the exchange settings and the trading Strategy as initial parameters. It connects to the API to retrieve the account's wallet and market data, computes new orders locally according to the strategy, and connects back to the API to apply updates.

VariableInfo.Name: Credentials
VariableInfo.Decription: Those are the credentials to an existing user account on the Exchange platform. The bot passes them as parameters while making API calls.

VariableInfo.Name: Exchange
VariableInfo.Decription: This entity contains information specific to the Bitcoin Exchange platform, such as commission fees, API urls and an optional Filter to apply on JSon results before Deserialization is performed. The expected data corresponds to Mt. Gox legacy API.

Instance.Name: Mt. Gox Exchange
Instance.Decription: Mt. Gox applies a 0,65% commission fee on each trade by default, and recently lowered the minimum order amount to 0,01 btc. The default urls point to the legacy API. No Filter is needed since the Mt. Gox JSon format serves as a reference to deserialize trading Entities.

VariableInfo.Name: Strategy
VariableInfo.Decription: The trading Strategy entity is expected to implement the ITradingStrategy interface, which exposes the following function to be overriden: Public MustOverride Function ComputeNewOrders(ByVal objWallet As Wallet, ByVal objMarket As MarketInfo, ByVal objExchange As ExchangeInfo) As Wallet Default Strategy implementation runs a band oriented trading algorithm with many parameters available for customization.

Instance.Name: Linear Trading Strategy
Instance.Decription:
The default strategy places orders in a trading band centered on the current market price. Pricing is symmetrical for asks and bids.
The ask order expression is defined by
Order.Value(Price) = aAsk * Price + bAsk or Order.Amount(Price) = aAsk + bAsk / Price
with aAsk and bAsk well defined by 2 points:
CurrentOrders.HighestAsk and LowestAskLimit
with the corresponding local variables:
LowestAskLimitPrice = Market.Ticker.Last * (1 + Exchange.AskCommission/100)
LowestAskLimitValue = CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100)
AskSpan = CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Price - LowestAskLimitPrice
The price distribution is defined by reducing the distance to the ticker. Default expression applies a linear.coefficient to the price
NewLowestAsk.Price = LowestAsk.Price * 99% until the central margin is reached
Existing orders can also be updated or cancelled to do some clean up when the Ticker moves, according to the defined parameters in the order updates tab. More specifically, you should make sure that your open orders are not cancelled every other run because of those parameters.

AskOrderAmountExpression.Expression: (CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan) + (((CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) - (LowestAskLimitPrice * CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan))/ Price)

VariableInfo.Name: History
VariableInfo.Decription: This parameter serves recording series of the balance and price collected during trading runs. It is also use by the default strategy to identify trading trends and avoid placing repeated orders when the price spikes quickly.

AskOrderAmountExpression.Expression: (CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan) + (((CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) - (LowestAskLimitPrice * CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan))/ Price)

VariableInfo.Decription: The value for check the customer has enough credits or not

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Collect Data
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This rule consists of a series of calls to the Exchange API to collect the account open orders and balance into a Wallet variable and the Ticker and MarketDepth into a Market variable.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Get Wallet
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: In order to create the corresponding wallet variable, one must collect the open orders and balance as Json through API calls and deserialize the corresponding strings into .Net variables before merging them into a Wallet entity.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Get Orders From API
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This web action posts the supplied credentials as parameters to a Http Post Request to the Exchange configured Url. It retrieves a Json string with open orders, which may also contain the balance (such as with MtGox legacy API)

VariableInfo.Name: nonce
VariableInfo.Decription: The request must contain an extra value "nonce" which must be an always incrementing numeric value.

VariableInfo.Name: Rest-Key
VariableInfo.Decription: This is the API key as generated from the Echange account settings

VariableInfo.Name: Rest-Sign
VariableInfo.Decription: This is the request signature generated from postdata using HMAC-SHA512.

VariableInfo.Name: hmac
VariableInfo.Decription: Keyed hash algorithm that is constructed from the SHA-512 hash function and used as a Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC)

VariableInfo.Name: key
VariableInfo.Decription: The secret key for HMAC encryption as generated from the Echange account settings

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Deserialize Wallet
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: The JsonWallet String variable previously retrieved can be deserialized into an instance of the corresponding Wallet class using a JayRock Serializer.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: JsonWallet exists
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This condition checks that the JsonWallet was correctly created by the previous web call.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Process Invalid Credentials
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Mt Gox bans IP addresses with too many failed login attempts. Accordingly, faulty user bots must be disabled to avoid the ban. A notification email also invites the user to update his password.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Wallet not null and Wallet has error
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This sub condition matches if the wallet was properly deserialized and its "error" field contains an error message

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Wallet is not null
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: this condition checks if the Wallet variable exists

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Wallet contains an error
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: In case of faulty credentials, Exchange sites return a json message of the form {"error":"Not logged in."} The corresponding deserialized object contains the appropriate field to be checked accordingly.

FleeExpression.Expression: Wallet.error.Contains("Must be logged in") Or Wallet.error.Contains("denied")

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Sub Conditions Provider
ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Allows to build a condition tree with sub conditions

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Static Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Simply matches according to the static value configured

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Dynamic Expression Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Matches according to the evaluation of a dynamic code expression defined in the Flee language

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Log Event Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Inserts a new log in the DotNetNuke event log. Automatic email alert can be configured accordingly

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Web Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Performs a web call to a web address

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Loop Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to loop running a sub bot over a custom collection. On each run, the current item of the collection is affected to a custom variable.

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Send Email Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Sends an email to a list of destination addresses. Token replace is available for all text fields and target address list.

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Define Variables Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to declare and instanciate a set of variables, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Multiple Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Runs sub sequences of Actions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Sub Bot Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to run a sub-bot as a dedicated action. Because of the sequential nature of the engine, the subbot triggers each previous step up to the current step, the rules and action should be configured accordingly

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Serialize Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to serialize a given entity, result of dynamic expression, into a string, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Deserialize Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to deserialize a given string, result of dynamic expression, into a typed object, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: While Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to loop running a sub bot while a boolean condition evaluates to true.

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Object Actions Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to call object methods or set object properties

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: String Filter Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to you to manipulate a string, by either running a series of transformations or performing xpath selects

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Empty Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider performs no particular action but can be used for adding a sleep time for instance

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: File Read Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to read a file to a given String variable, given its path by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: File Write Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to write a content to a file, given its path and the content to write by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: File Manager Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to browse or delete files and folders, given a parent path by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Execute Sql Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Execute a call to a stored procedure, a Sql script or sql query and returns the result

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Run Program Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Run an executable program given its path and parameters

BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Name: Bitcoin - Cryptsy Trader 1.0
BotInfoOfScheduleEvent.Decription:
This bot is an automated trader connecting to the Mt. Gox Bitcoins exchange's API. See www.mtgox.com and www.bitcoin.org for more information.
The bot takes some user account Credentials, the exchange settings and the trading Strategy as initial parameters. It connects to the API to retrieve the account's wallet and market data, computes new orders locally according to the strategy, and connects back to the API to apply updates.

VariableInfo.Name: Credentials
VariableInfo.Decription: Those are the credentials to an existing user account on the Exchange platform. The bot passes them as parameters while making API calls.

VariableInfo.Name: Exchange
VariableInfo.Decription: This entity contains information specific to the Bitcoin Exchange platform, such as commission fees, API urls and an optional Filter to apply on JSon results before Deserialization is performed. The expected data corresponds to Mt. Gox legacy API.

VariableInfo.Name: Strategy
VariableInfo.Decription: The trading Strategy entity is expected to implement the ITradingStrategy interface, which exposes the following function to be overriden: Public MustOverride Function ComputeNewOrders(ByVal objWallet As Wallet, ByVal objMarket As MarketInfo, ByVal objExchange As ExchangeInfo) As Wallet Default Strategy implementation runs a band oriented trading algorithm with many parameters available for customization.

Instance.Name: Linear Trading Strategy
Instance.Decription:
The default strategy places orders in a trading band centered on the current market price. Pricing is symmetrical for asks and bids.
The ask order expression is defined by
Order.Value(Price) = aAsk * Price + bAsk or Order.Amount(Price) = aAsk + bAsk / Price
with aAsk and bAsk well defined by 2 points:
CurrentOrders.HighestAsk and LowestAskLimit
with the corresponding local variables:
LowestAskLimitPrice = Market.Ticker.Last * (1 + Exchange.AskCommission/100)
LowestAskLimitValue = CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100)
AskSpan = CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Price - LowestAskLimitPrice
The price distribution is defined by reducing the distance to the ticker. Default expression applies a linear.coefficient to the price
NewLowestAsk.Price = LowestAsk.Price * 99% until the central margin is reached
Existing orders can also be updated or cancelled to do some clean up when the Ticker moves, according to the defined parameters in the order updates tab. More specifically, you should make sure that your open orders are not cancelled every other run because of those parameters.

AskOrderAmountExpression.Expression: (CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan) + (((CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) - (LowestAskLimitPrice * CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan))/ Price)

VariableInfo.Name: History
VariableInfo.Decription: This parameter serves recording series of the balance and price collected during trading runs. It is also use by the default strategy to identify trading trends and avoid placing repeated orders when the price spikes quickly.

AskOrderAmountExpression.Expression: (CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan) + (((CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) - (LowestAskLimitPrice * CurrentOrders.HighestAsk.Value * (1 - Strategy.LimitOrderValueRate / 100) / AskSpan))/ Price)

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Load Proxy Pool
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription:
This rule builds a proxy pool from a combination of configuration data, and data automatically extracted by running a Xpath Query against a series of web pages.
Default parameters gather a collection of open proxies, and should not be used to post sensitive information, but rather illustrates building variable from web content.
Also, note that Google enforces a strict policy of blocking proxies generating too much traffic. Accordingly, most open proxies gathered by the bot will fail the verification test configured within the ProxyPool variable definition, which is expected behaviour. If you want to use open proxies for a distinct purpose, you should change the verification url to your need, allowing for more proxies to be validated.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Create ProxyPool
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We instantiate an object of type WebProxyPool and put it in cache for later reuse.

VariableInfo.Name: ProxyPool
VariableInfo.Decription: The pool is defined as a simple variable, which allows you to add your own predefined proxies. ProxyPool is the name of the variable defined here. The Use Clone option is checked, so that additional proxies added when the bot is executed do not impact the original proxy pool definition. In the verification tab, we set a template request as verification mean to only keep proxies allowed to issue that kind of request.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Feed ProxyPool
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: If the Proxypool has less than the defined minimum number of proxies, we feed the pool with open proxies gathered on the web.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: ProxyPool has few available proxies
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We feed the pool with new proxies only if it has less available proxies than the minimum number defined

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Clean Old Proxies
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Before we add new proxies, we remove the existing proxies which have proved unreliable through multiple testing.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: ProxyNodes exists
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We only perform that action if the previous parsing was successful, ie if the corresponding variable was created.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: For each page of open Proxies
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We loop against a series of pages, which contain open proxies. The Integer parameter ProxyPageNb allows to define the url of each page.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Get Proxies Page
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We obtain a list of open proxies from the site hidemyass.com. We request the corresponding page for later parsing. This http request itself makes use of the proxy pool to be fed with new proxies. Note the use of the ProxyPageNb parameter from the outer loop to define the url.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: ProxyPool has less that 3 available proxies
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We feed the pool with new proxies only if it has less that 3 available proxies left.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Select Proxy Nodes
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We now parse the httprequest String response using XPath queries to retrieve the individual proxy parameters, namely the domain, port, speed, connection time and scheme. That action resturns a list of dictionaries with the corresponding parameters. We enable the "Add if Existing" option to merge the results of each page into a single list variable. Note that the compound XPath query extracts html tags as well as attributes.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: HtmlProxies is not empty
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We perform that opertion only if the previous httprequest succesfully responded with the target page to be parsed.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: For each Proxy Node
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We go over the list of dictionaries built with the xpath parsing of the original page, and build Proxy objects from the corresponding parameters

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: ProxyNodes exists
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We only perform that action if the previous parsing was successful, ie if the corresponding variable was created.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Add Proxy to Pool
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: To add a proxy to the pool, we operate on the ProxyPool variable directly. We add a condition to filter out proxies too slow or with an unsupported scheme.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Proxy is fast enough and Sheme is Http
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: .Net WebProxy only supports Http proxies, so we have to filter out https and socks proxies from the list. Furthermore, we filter out proxies with slow speed or slow connection time

VariableInfo.Name: webProxy
VariableInfo.Decription: The WebProxyInfo class contains a constructor, which we can use with the parsed parameters.

VariableInfo.Name: strAddress
VariableInfo.Decription: We concatenate the parameters to form the complete proxy address

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Restore Disabled Accounts
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This is a disabled rule sometimes useful when the exchange keeps deauthenticating valid accounts.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: In order to create the corresponding Market variable, one must collect the Ticker and MarketDepth as Json through API calls and deserialize the corresponding strings into .Net variables before merging them into a Market entity.

VariableInfo.Name: method
VariableInfo.Decription: Name of the method called from cryptsy public API See https://www.cryptsy.com/pages/api

VariableInfo.Name: nonce
VariableInfo.Decription: The request must contain an extra value "nonce" which must be an always incrementing numeric value.

VariableInfo.Name: Sign
VariableInfo.Decription: This is the request signature generated from postdata using HMAC-SHA512.

VariableInfo.Name: hmac
VariableInfo.Decription: Keyed hash algorithm that is constructed from the SHA-512 hash function and used as a Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC)

VariableInfo.Name: key
VariableInfo.Decription: The secret key for HMAC encryption as generated from the Echange account settings

VariableInfo.Name: Key
VariableInfo.Decription: This is the API key as generated from the Echange account settings

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: JsonActiveMarkets exists
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This condition checks that the JsonActiveMarkets variable was correctly created by the previous web call.

VariableInfo.Name: method
VariableInfo.Decription: Name of the method called from cryptsy public API See https://www.cryptsy.com/pages/api

VariableInfo.Name: marketid
VariableInfo.Decription: market id for the specific cryptocurrency market pair see https://www.cryptsy.com/pages/api

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: JsonTicker exists
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This condition checks that the JsonTicker variable was correctly created by the previous web call.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Convert Exchange Object to Market
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This action builds an object of type MarketInfo from the Cryptsy Object

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Ticker exist
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This condition checks that json response was deserialized properly and contain a success indicator.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Declare HistoricTrades and Corresponding Folder path
If Cache empty load HistoricTrades from local files
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: If HistoricTrades is not in cache, look up the disk to load the csv file previously downloaded.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Read Historic Trades From Local File

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Historic Trades is empty or enough new trades need saving
Half new trades were not saved

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Add new trades to declared variable

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: HistoricTrades is empty or CurrentTrade is newer

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Get Market Depth
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This request is currently skipped and replaced with simulation data to save bandwidth since the existing strategy does not make use of it. If you wish to use the market depth, unckeck simulation mode.

VariableInfo.Name: method
VariableInfo.Decription: Name of the method called from cryptsy public API See https://www.cryptsy.com/pages/api

VariableInfo.Name: marketid
VariableInfo.Decription: market id for the specific cryptocurrency market pair see https://www.cryptsy.com/pages/api

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: JsonDepth exists
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This condition checks that the JsonDepth was correctly created by the previous web call.

ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Consolidate Market Data
ActionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This action builds an object of type MarketInfo thanks to the Cryptsy Objects available

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Ticker And MarketDepth exist
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This condition checks that both json response could be deserialized properly and contain a success indicator.

FleeExpression.Expression: Ticker<>null and Depth<>null and Ticker.Success=1 and Depth.Success=1

VariableInfo.Name: sourceMarket
VariableInfo.Decription: The sourceMarket initial constructor parameter using a conversion method from the Cryptsy class

VariableInfo.Name: additionalData
VariableInfo.Decription: The additionalData constructor parameter using a conversion method from the Cryptsy class

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Credentials Are Valid
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This condition checks if the credentials variable is valid, i.e, the password is non empty, and it was not disabled on a previous run.

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Perform Computations
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This rule computes the NewOrders variable as a Wallet entity computed by passing the Exchange, Wallet and Market variables to the Strategy.

ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Name: Collected Variables are valid
ConditionProviderSettingsOfScheduleEvent.Decription: We make sure we have collected all the needed information from the web services.

KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Name: Execute New Orders
KeeperRuleOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This rule uses the NewOrders variable to emit API calls to the Exchange platform. Orders are divided into Cancel orders, Asks orders and Bid orders

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Sub Conditions Provider
ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Allows to build a condition tree with sub conditions

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Static Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Simply matches according to the static value configured

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Dynamic Expression Condition
ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Matches according to the evaluation of a dynamic code expression defined in the Flee language

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Log Event Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Inserts a new log in the DotNetNuke event log. Automatic email alert can be configured accordingly

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Web Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Performs a web call to a web address

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Loop Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to loop running a sub bot over a custom collection. On each run, the current item of the collection is affected to a custom variable.

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Send Email Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Sends an email to a list of destination addresses. Token replace is available for all text fields and target address list.

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Define Variables Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to declare and instanciate a set of variables, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Multiple Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Runs sub sequences of Actions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Sub Bot Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to run a sub-bot as a dedicated action. Because of the sequential nature of the engine, the subbot triggers each previous step up to the current step, the rules and action should be configured accordingly

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Serialize Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to serialize a given entity, result of dynamic expression, into a string, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Deserialize Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to deserialize a given string, result of dynamic expression, into a typed object, which will be stored in the context "Item" dictionary

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: While Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to loop running a sub bot while a boolean condition evaluates to true.

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Object Actions Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to call object methods or set object properties

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: String Filter Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to you to manipulate a string, by either running a series of transformations or performing xpath selects

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Empty Action Provider
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider performs no particular action but can be used for adding a sleep time for instance

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: File Read Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to read a file to a given String variable, given its path by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: File Write Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to write a content to a file, given its path and the content to write by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: File Manager Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: This provider allows to browse or delete files and folders, given a parent path by dynamic expressions

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Execute Sql Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Execute a call to a stored procedure, a Sql script or sql query and returns the result

ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Name: Run Program Action
ActionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Run an executable program given its path and parameters

RedditCommand.Name: Make Payment
RedditCommand.Decription: This is a command to make payments with Blockchain

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Matches according to client identifying source parameters (Session, IP Address, country etc.)

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Matches according to the target DNN Page as defined in the url

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Matches according to the evaluation of a dynamic code expression defined in the Flee language

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Matches according to the user membership

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Matches according to the portal alias used in the url

ConditionProviderConfigOfScheduleEvent.Decription: Simply matches according to the static value configured
